alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 3:50PM EST until January 09 at 4:30PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Alamance County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Randolph County in central North Carolina... Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until 430 PM EST. * At 349 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Bethany to near Greensboro to 6 miles northwest of Randleman, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Burlington, Graham, Elon, McLeansville, Archdale, Summerfield, Gibsonville, and Pleasant Garden. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central North Carolina. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central North Carolina.
